intro: Byrsonima altissima, commonly known as the "great balsa tree," is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, round seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Due to its lightweight wood, it has been historically used for various practical applications.
